properties.name: animationConfig
properties.description:
The entry and exit animations that will be played when showing and
hiding the tooltip. If you want to override this, you must ensure
that your animationConfig has the exact format below.

properties.name: entryAnimation
properties.description:
Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: exitAnimation
properties.description:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: for
properties.description:
The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip.

properties.name: manualMode
properties.description:
Set this to true if you want to manually control when the tooltip
is shown or hidden.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

properties.name: fitToVisibleBounds
properties.description: If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

properties.name: offset
properties.description:
The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

properties.name: marginTop
properties.description:
This property is deprecated, but left over so that it doesn't
break exiting code. Please use `offset` instead. If both `offset` and
`marginTop` are provided, `marginTop` will be ignored.

properties.name: animationDelay
properties.description:
The delay that will be applied before the `entry` animation is
played when showing the tooltip.

properties.name: target
properties.description:
Returns the target element that this tooltip is anchored to. It is
either the element given by the `for` attribute, or the immediate parent
of the tooltip.

methods.name: getAnimationConfig
methods.description:
An element implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimationRunnerBehavior` calls this method to configure
an animation with an optional type. Elements implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`
should define the property `animationConfig`, which is either a configuration object
or a map of animation type to array of configuration objects.

methods.name: playAnimation
methods.description: Plays an animation with an optional `type`.
